title: Jonathan Ross to host James Bond TV special
text:
Jonathan Ross to host James Bond TV special Jonathan Ross to host James Bond TV special 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Jonathan Ross is to live out his biggest dream – hosting a James Bond TV special celebrating the release of the spy’s new adventure Spectre. 
The hour-long special will feature the TV presenter interviewing star Daniel Craig, who reprises his role as the secret agent for the fourth time. Daniel Craig as James Bond in Spectre (Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Studios/PA) 
Bond fan Jonathan will also interview Daniel’s co-stars Naomie Harris (Eve Moneypenny), Andrew Scott (British government member Max Denbigh) and Christoph Waltz (villain Franz Oberhauser), as well as Bond girls Monica Bellucci (Lucia Sciarra) and Lea Seydoux (psychologist Dr Madeleine Swann). Naomie Harris, Lea Seydoux, Daniel Craig, Monica Bellucci and Christoph Waltz at the revealing of the new James Bond film Spectre (Ian West/PA) 
The 54-year-old will also get an insight into the classic cars, impressive gadgets, evil villains and beautiful Bond girls of the previous films in the spy franchise, ahead of the release of the 24th film on October 26. Watch the final trailer for #SPECTRE https://t.co/8zm77b0A7k 
— James Bond (@007) October 2, 2015 
Jonathan said: “As a lifelong fan of James Bond, I’m thrilled to be involved with this exclusive behind-the-scenes look at what promises to be 007′s greatest adventure so far.” Share article 
James Bond’s Spectre – With Jonathan Ross will air on ITV in the autumn. Promoted Stories
